alert.note: Alert for San Luis Obispo County Beaches; Santa Barbara County Central Coast Beaches (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued December 07 at 1:49PM PST until December 08 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Large breaking waves of 9 to 13 feet and dangerous rip currents. Highest across west and northwest facing beaches. * WHERE...San Luis Obispo County Beaches and Santa Barbara County Central Coast Beaches. * WHEN...Until 4 PM PST Friday. * IMPACTS...There is an increased risk for ocean drowning. Rip currents can pull swimmers and surfers out to sea. Large breaking waves can cause injury, wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats near shore.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions, or stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Rock jetties can be deadly in such conditions, stay off the rocks.

area.areaDesc: San Luis Obispo County Beaches; Santa Barbara County Central Coast Beaches
